meanings.definition: A unit of weight in ancient Egypt, equivalent to about 1.1 pounds.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Egypt, a nome was a measure of weight.
meanings.sent2: The nome was used to weigh precious stones in ancient times.
meanings.sent3: I wonder how much a nome of gold would cost today.
meanings.sent4: Her determination weighed more than a nome of stones.
meanings.sent5: The merchant carefully measured out a nome of spices for the recipe.

meanings.definition: A city or town in ancient Greece.
meanings.sent1: The ancient Greeks built their homes in a nome.
meanings.sent2: Travelers often visited the nome to experience its rich history.
meanings.sent3: I dreamt of wandering the streets of an ancient nome last night.
meanings.sent4: The nome stood like a beacon of civilization in the ancient world.
meanings.sent5: The agora was the heart of every nome in ancient Greece.

meanings.definition: A region or district in Italy.
meanings.sent1: The beautiful vineyards covered the entire nome in Italy.
meanings.sent2: Each nome in Italy had its own unique culture and traditions.
meanings.sent3: I would love to explore the quaint villages of that nome in Italy.
meanings.sent4: The nome in Italy was like a patchwork quilt of colors and flavors.
meanings.sent5: The olive groves stretched as far as the eye could see in the nome.

meanings.sent1: The musician composed a nome that touched the hearts of many.
meanings.sent2: The nome was performed by a talented orchestra at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The nome played by the band had everyone dancing in the streets.
meanings.sent4: Her voice soared through the air like a nome in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody of the nome lingered in the minds of the audience.
